abstract: An action that presents the settings scene for an app.
overview:
## Overview

Use the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/EnvironmentValues/openSettings] environment value to get the instance of this structure for a given [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Environment]. Then call the instance to open a window. You call the instance directly because it defines a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/OpenSettingsAction/callAsFunction()] method that Swift calls when you call the instance.

For example, you can define a button that opens the settings window to a particular tab:

items.description: Opens the window associated to the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Settings] scene defined by this app, if one exists.
